tool.name: PointPlots

param.name: polygon
param.dialogReference: Area of the project - either a user drawn polygon or existing feature

param.name: out_point
param.dialogReference: The output feature class path of the point plots

param.name: reduce_acreage
param.displayname: Reduce surveyed area for large (> 5 acres) buffers to 5%?
param.dialogReference: If selected, planting areas > 5 acres will use a plot radius of 26.3ft and 1 / acre. Otherwise the <5 acres rate is used

tool.summary:
This tool creates point plots for a given analysis area based of the Upper Susquehanna Coalition (USC) riparian forest buffer yearly monitoring program rates:

  • < 1 acres - plot radius 11.8ft; 10 / acre

  • < 5 acres - plot radius 26.3ft; 2 / acre

  • > 5 acres - plot radius 26.3ft; 1 / acre (if option is selected, otherwise it uses the <5 acres rate)

searchKeys.keyword: Point Plots Riparian Forest Buffer Planting
